intro: Kotschya thymodora subsp. septentrionalis, commonly known as the northern thyme-leaf kotschya, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its small, aromatic leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant is native to the mountainous regions of Central America and northern South America. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in cloud forests. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
